brief_summary.textblock:
OBJECTIVES:

      I.  Determine the therapeutic efficacy and safety of topical calcitriol in children with
      psoriasis.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Topical Calcitriol in Children With Psoriasis

detailed_description.textblock:
PROTOCOL OUTLINE: Patients apply topical calcitriol in petrolatum on a psoriatic lesion
      daily. Patients also apply petrolatum without calcitriol to another psoriatic lesion daily.

      Patients have both lesions photographed prior to therapy, monthly during therapy, and at the
      completion of therapy.  Lesions are assessed weekly for 1 month and then every 2 weeks while
      on study.  Blood samples are collected every 1 to 2 months and urine samples are collected
      every 2 weeks while on study.

criteria.textblock:
PROTOCOL ENTRY CRITERIA:

        --Disease Characteristics--

        Diagnosis of psoriasis At least 2 lesions with area at least 30-50 cm2

        --Prior/Concurrent Therapy--

        No other concurrent therapy for psoriasis No concurrent calcium supplements greater than
        1,000 mg/day No concurrent prednisone or other drugs affecting serum or urine calcium
        levels

        --Patient Characteristics--

        Renal: No high blood or urinary calcium levels

        Other: Not pregnant Negative pregnancy test Fertile patients must use effective
        contraception

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.
